events.name: EU sanctions against Russia
events.wd_description: The European Union is discussing further sanction packages to be levied against Russia due to its continued invasion of Ukraine. These sanctions aim to target oil and other economic areas to deter further military aggression.
events.description: The European Union is discussing further sanction packages to be levied against Russia due to its continued invasion of Ukraine. These sanctions aim to target oil and other economic areas to deter further military aggression.

events.name: Sanctions discussion
events.wd_description: Several EU leaders are building sanctions regarding oil and other economic deterrents.
events.description: Several EU leaders are building sanctions regarding oil and other economic deterrents.

events.name: Bucha aftermath
events.wd_description: The discovery of slain Ukrainian civilians in Bucha has intensified the call for further sanctions against Russia.
events.description: The discovery of slain Ukrainian civilians in Bucha has intensified the call for further sanctions against Russia.

events.name: EU leaders involvement
events.wd_description: Leaders of Ireland, Lithuania, and Denmark, among others, are involved in this next round of sanctions against Russia, hoping that the measures will lead to Russia's withdrawal from Ukraine.
events.description: Leaders of Ireland, Lithuania, and Denmark, among others, are involved in this next round of sanctions against Russia, hoping that the measures will lead to Russia's withdrawal from Ukraine.

events.name: Severe thunderstorms in Ontario and Quebec, May 2022
events.wd_label: Severe thunderstorms in Ontario and Quebec, May 2022
events.wd_description: Severe thunderstorms swept through Ontario and Central Quebec, causing widespread power outages, destruction of property, and leading to five deaths and several injuries.
events.description: Severe thunderstorms swept through Ontario and Central Quebec, causing widespread power outages, destruction of property, and leading to five deaths and several injuries.

events.name: Thunderstorms in Ontario
events.wd_description: Thunderstorms in Ontario, beginning in Sarnia and moving towards Ottawa, left more than 350,000 customers without power, caused widespread damage, and resulted in five deaths.
events.description: Thunderstorms in Ontario, beginning in Sarnia and moving towards Ottawa, left more than 350,000 customers without power, caused widespread damage, and resulted in five deaths.

events.name: Thunderstorms in Quebec
events.wd_description: Similar thunderstorms in Central Quebec left more than 500,000 homes without power, destroying homes, electricity lines, and trees.
events.description: Similar thunderstorms in Central Quebec left more than 500,000 homes without power, destroying homes, electricity lines, and trees.

events.name: Response and recovery efforts
events.wd_description: Crews were mobilized to restore power and services to the regions affected by the thunderstorms in Ontario and Quebec.
events.description: Crews were mobilized to restore power and services to the regions affected by the thunderstorms in Ontario and Quebec.

events.name: Boris Johnson comments on Putin's progress in Donbas
events.wd_label: Boris Johnson comments on Putin's progress in Donbas
events.wd_description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson commented on Russian President Vladimir Putin's slow but visible progress in the Donbas region of Eastern Ukraine, expressing concerns over the high cost to Russia.
events.description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson commented on Russian President Vladimir Putin's slow but visible progress in the Donbas region of Eastern Ukraine, expressing concerns over the high cost to Russia.

events.name: Putin's progress in Donbas
events.wd_description: Johnson noted that Putin continues to make progress in Donbas, despite the high cost to himself and the Russian military.
events.description: Johnson noted that Putin continues to make progress in Donbas, despite the high cost to himself and the Russian military.

events.name: Invasion background
events.wd_description: Russia's invasion of Ukraine, launched on February 24, is termed a "special military operation" by Russia, but is considered a war of aggression by Ukraine and the West.
events.description: Russia's invasion of Ukraine, launched on February 24, is termed a "special military operation" by Russia, but is considered a war of aggression by Ukraine and the West.

events.name: Johnson's perspective on ending the conflict
events.wd_label: Johnson's perspective on ending the conflict
events.wd_description: Johnson stated that the conflict can end only if Putin acknowledges that the denazification of Ukraine has been achieved and withdraws with dignity and honor, although he clarified he does not support the premise that there were Nazis in Ukraine.
events.description: Johnson stated that the conflict can end only if Putin acknowledges that the denazification of Ukraine has been achieved and withdraws with dignity and honor, although he clarified he does not support the premise that there were Nazis in Ukraine.

events.name: Challenges in accelerating EV adoption
events.wd_description: Accelerating EV adoption rates are facing challenges due to surging lithium-ion battery costs and weakening supply chains, prompting calls for enhanced domestic mineral production and research in alternative battery storage technologies.
events.description: Accelerating EV adoption rates are facing challenges due to surging lithium-ion battery costs and weakening supply chains, prompting calls for enhanced domestic mineral production and research in alternative battery storage technologies.

events.name: US light-duty EV sales
events.wd_description: US light-duty EV sales totaled 608,000 in 2021, more than double 2020's sales, with projections to reach 849,000 in 2022 and 4.7 million by 2030.
events.description: US light-duty EV sales totaled 608,000 in 2021, more than double 2020's sales, with projections to reach 849,000 in 2022 and 4.7 million by 2030.

events.name: Lithium price surge
events.wd_description: Lithium carbonate prices soared to $75,000/mt in April 2022, nearly 12 times higher than at the beginning of 2021, with much of the world's lithium produced in China.
events.description: Lithium carbonate prices soared to $75,000/mt in April 2022, nearly 12 times higher than at the beginning of 2021, with much of the world's lithium produced in China.

events.name: Cost impact of battery metals
events.wd_description: Anne Robba noted that key battery metals account for approximately 12% of battery pack costs, and price surges in these metals have only increased EV prices by 5-8%.
events.description: Anne Robba noted that key battery metals account for approximately 12% of battery pack costs, and price surges in these metals have only increased EV prices by 5-8%.

events.name: Decline in EV battery cell prices
events.wd_label: Decline in EV battery cell prices
events.wd_description: EV battery cell prices have fallen 760% since 2015 to less than $150/KWh in 2021, with forecasts to fall below $100/kWh by 2026, making EVs more cost-competitive with internal combustion engine vehicles.
events.description: EV battery cell prices have fallen 760% since 2015 to less than $150/KWh in 2021, with forecasts to fall below $100/kWh by 2026, making EVs more cost-competitive with internal combustion engine vehicles.

events.name: Supply chain constraints
events.wd_description: Scott Aaronson highlighted challenges in the supply chain due to low supplies, shipping shortages, material shortages, manufacturing challenges, and high demand.
events.description: Scott Aaronson highlighted challenges in the supply chain due to low supplies, shipping shortages, material shortages, manufacturing challenges, and high demand.

events.name: Need for redundancies
events.wd_description: The electric industry seeks redundancies for key supply chain components to prevent failures, with a focus on opportunities beyond lithium-ion.
events.description: The electric industry seeks redundancies for key supply chain components to prevent failures, with a focus on opportunities beyond lithium-ion.

events.name: US lithium production challenges
events.wd_description: Ned Mamula noted that the US is highly import-dependent on lithium due to permitting restrictions and regulations that limit domestic production.
events.description: Ned Mamula noted that the US is highly import-dependent on lithium due to permitting restrictions and regulations that limit domestic production.

events.name: Permitting burden
events.wd_description: Reducing the permitting burden on mining companies to standards comparable to other developed nations could improve the situation, as opening a mine in the US can take up to 10 years.
events.description: Reducing the permitting burden on mining companies to standards comparable to other developed nations could improve the situation, as opening a mine in the US can take up to 10 years.

events.name: Sourcing from friendly countries
events.wd_description: In the shorter term, the US can turn to sourcing materials from more friendly countries to address supply challenges.
events.description: In the shorter term, the US can turn to sourcing materials from more friendly countries to address supply challenges.

events.name: Alternative energy storage systems
events.wd_description: Alternative energy storage systems have gained attention, with Eric Dresselhuys highlighting the inefficiencies in the existing EV battery storage supply chain.
events.description: Alternative energy storage systems have gained attention, with Eric Dresselhuys highlighting the inefficiencies in the existing EV battery storage supply chain.

events.name: Recycling and abundant materials
events.wd_description: Near-term options include recycling existing resources and replacing them with more abundant materials.
events.description: Near-term options include recycling existing resources and replacing them with more abundant materials.
